video:video.video:title: Visual Studio Express for Windows 8 in 10 Minutes
video:video.video:description: Summary: Visual Studio, even the express editions like Visual Studio Express for Windows 8, can be daunting to those who have never worked with the tools. Fortunately, you only need to learn perhaps&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Fast and fluid animation sample
video:video.video:description: This video show a fast and fluid animation sample for a Windows Store app.

video:video.video:title: 3D Game Example
video:video.video:description: This video shows how 3D graphics render in a game example.

video:video.video:title: Hardware accelerating everything: Windows 8 graphics
video:video.video:description: In computer graphics, high performance is a guiding principle. In Windows 8, we knew we wanted to create a new, visually rich way for users to interact with apps and with Windows itself. We knew that&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Using your feedback to make Narrator work better with touch
video:video.video:description: This video show how Microsoft took the suggestions of our users to help make Narrator work better in Windows 8.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Introducing the Photos app for Windows 8
video:video.video:description: The Windows 8 Photos app introduces a new way to enjoy more of your photos. We realize the myriad places you have to go to see all of your photos, so we decided to bring them all to you in one place.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Protecting user files with File History
video:video.video:description: File History in Windows 8 is designed to make it to protect your personal files. We also changed our approach to data protection to adapt it better to our modern, mobile lifestyles.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Building a rich and extensible Media Platform
video:video.video:description: Engaging with rich media—whether watching a movie, video chatting, or playing music—is one of the most prevalent and enjoyable things we do on our PCs today.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The People appthe complete, cloud-powered address book for Windows 8
video:video.video:description: The People app—the complete, cloud-powered address book for Windows 8. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/06/13/the-people-app-the-complete-cloud-powered-address-book-for-windows-8.aspx

video:video.video:title: Enhancing Windows 8 for multiple monitors
video:video.video:description: This blog post covers the new and improved experiences for Multimon. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/05/21/enhancing-windows-8-for-multiple-monitors.aspx

video:video.video:title: Designing PCs that boot faster than ever before
video:video.video:description: This video shows you how to use Windows Startup settings to reboot your PC quickly into different modes.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows 95 Usability Testing - 1993
video:video.video:description: Here is an historic video of a person in our usability labs trying an early build of Windows 95 which shows an example of the kind of problems many people had: This video is from 1993.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows 95 Start button
video:video.video:description: This video teaches consumers how to use the Windows 95 Start button. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/05/18/creating-the-windows-8-user-experience.aspx

video:video.video:title: Keeping your family safer with Windows 8
video:video.video:description: This blog post shows how to set family safety settings to keep your kids safe. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/05/14/keeping-your-family-safer-with-windows-8.aspx

video:video.video:title: Cloud services for Windows 8 and Windows Phone
video:video.video:description: Windows 8 is designed to be cloud-powered, so it comes with Metro style apps for communication, sharing, scheduling, photos, and videos. Preview versions of these apps come installed with the Windows&#8230;

video:video.video:title: SkyDrive video
video:video.video:description: This video shows how easy it is to collaborate and share files, photos, and apps, in order to create a winning presentation using SkyDrive.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Reclaiming memory from Metro style apps
video:video.video:description: This video shows how Windows 8 can improve memory and Metro style app responsiveness. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/04/17/reclaiming-memory-from-metro-style-apps.aspx

video:video.video:title: Supporting sensors in Windows 8
video:video.video:description: Windows 8 can support sensors including; adaptive brightness and automatic screen rotation. Windows 8 is powerful and handling the accelerometer with a low-pass filter to prevent images from being&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Touch hardware and Windows 8
video:video.video:description: This video shows some examples of how hardware can affect the Windows 8 touch language. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/03/28/touch-hardware-and-windows-8.aspx

video:video.video:title: Internet Explorer 10 Consumer Preview
video:video.video:description: To deliver the best browsing across all Windows 8 devices, we re-imagined the architecture and experience of the web browser with Internet Explorer 10. &#8230;

video:video.video:title: First Apps Contest Winners
video:video.video:description: This video showcases the winners of the First Apps for Windows 8. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsstore/archive/2012/02/29/introducing-the-winners-of-the-first-apps-contest.aspx

video:video.video:title: Connecting your apps, files, PCs, and devices to the cloud with SkyDrive and Windows 8
video:video.video:description: Connecting your apps, files, PCs and devices to the cloud with SkyDrive and Windows 8.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Submitting your Windows 8 apps
video:video.video:description: Windows 8 apps are the heart of the Windows Store. When designing the app submission experience, we wanted developers to be able to load their apps into the Store as easily as possible. We thought a&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Ensuring Accessibility
video:video.video:description: This video shows how Windows 8 will help users with visual impairments to enjoy Windows 8 touch first interface by using Magnifier and Narrator.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Building Windows for the ARM processor architecture
video:video.video:description: Windows on ARM is a new member of the Windows family that builds on the foundation of Windows. These PCs will be built by PC manufacturers and based on unique and innovative hardware platforms&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Engineering Windows 8 for mobility
video:video.video:description: This video demonstrates some of a great ways that Windows 8 is designed for mobility from instant reconnect to cost-aware networking.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Designing the Windows Store user experience
video:video.video:description: The Windows Store landing page was built to bring apps to the forefront allowing for the brand and personality of the apps to shine!&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Refresh and reset your PC
video:video.video:description: Learn how PCs can be recovered using the Refresh and Reset features in Windows 8. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2012/01/04/refresh-and-reset-your-pc.aspx

video:video.video:title: Designing a secure boot experience with modern firmware
video:video.video:description: This video presentation discusses the secure boot policies for Windows 8.

video:video.video:title: Designing a simplified boot experience with modern firmware
video:video.video:description: This video presentation discusses some of the problems with the boot experience today and compares it to the improvements available for the modern boot experience with Windows 8. With UEFI and Windows&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Delivering a secure and fast boot experience with UEFI
video:video.video:description: This video discusses some of the key benefits to UEFI in Windows 8. Listen to industry expert's views on UEFI and Windows 8. Explore ideas for system and firmware design. Learn how you can benefit&#8230;

video:video.video:title: System design for the Modern PC
video:video.video:description: This video presentation focuses on how UEFI impacts system designers. It discusses how Windows 8 has two separate boot plans to choose from.

video:video.video:title: Option ROM designs for UEFI
video:video.video:description: This video presentation is geared at the IHV community who designs Option ROMs. It discusses why the UEFI framework is important to reduce code complexity. It also covers how Microsoft is helping&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Preparing for Security in Windows 8
video:video.video:description: Learn all about the Windows 8 security investiments and how you can prepare to secure your systems for Windows 8.

video:video.video:title: Building Hardware-accelerated Encrypted Storage Devices (eDrives) in Windows 8
video:video.video:description: This video presentation discusses how to build hardware-accelerated encrypted storage drives (eDrives) in Windows 8. It also dives into details on the differences between eDrives and self-encrypting&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Signing in with a picture password
video:video.video:description: Passwords can be complex and hard to remember. With picture passwords, it's easy to use and simple to remember how to sign in to your computer.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Certifying wireless devices using the Windows Hardware Certification Kit
video:video.video:description: Learn how you can certify your wireless devices using the Windows Hardware Certification Kit or (WHCK). This video discusses how you can test your Wireless LAN (WLAN) and mobile broadband (MB) devices&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Using a TPM virtual smart card
video:video.video:description: Have you ever needed a smart card and didn't have it present? This video shows you how you can use the TPM virtual smart card to log on to your corporate Intranet.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Hyper-V
video:video.video:description: This video shows how using Hyper-V is easy. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/09/07/bringing-hyper-v-to-windows-8.aspx

video:video.video:title: Accessing Data in ISO and VHD files
video:video.video:description: Learn how to access data in ISO and VHD files. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/08/30/accessing-data-in-iso-and-vhd-files.aspx

video:video.video:title: Improvements in Windows Explorer
video:video.video:description: Windows Explorer in Windows 8 has many great new features. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/08/29/improvements-in-windows-explorer.aspx

video:video.video:title: Delivering fast boot times in Windows 8
video:video.video:description: Fast Boot is even faster than you ever imagined. Watch this video to find out how fast! https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/09/08/delivering-fast-boot-times-in-windows-8.aspx

video:video.video:title: Signing in to Windows 8 with a Windows Live ID
video:video.video:description: This video showcases how Windows 8 will allow a user's settings to persist from one computer to another by logging in using your Windows Live ID.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Optimizing for both landscape and portrait
video:video.video:description: The Windows 8 rotation experience from landscape to portrait is fast and fluid. Each application can tailor the view to what makes the most sense for portrait.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Designing search for the Start screen
video:video.video:description: The Windows 8 Start search is the most efficient way to find and launch your apps, settings, and files.

video:video.video:title: Live tile notifications, Sept 10-14, 2011
video:video.video:description: Using Live Tiles changes the way that people receive information. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/11/02/updating-live-tiles-without-draining-your-battery.aspx

video:video.video:title: Improving file management basics
video:video.video:description: File management is a key feature for any experienced user. Learn how Windows 8 can make file management better than ever!

video:video.video:title: Building robust USB 3.0 support
video:video.video:description: USB 3.0 is even better than ever! Learn how USB 3.0 speed compares to USB 2.0. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/08/22/building-robust-usb-3-0-support.aspx

video:video.video:title: Improving the Setup experience
video:video.video:description: This video discusses how to setup Windows 8 through a USB key. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/11/21/improving-the-setup-experience.aspx

video:video.video:title: Previewing The Windows Store
video:video.video:description: The Windows Store is a new way for developers to be able to upload new apps in Windows 8. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsstore/archive/2011/12/06/announcing-the-new-windows-store.aspx

video:video.video:title: Windows 8 Task Manager
video:video.video:description: The Windows 8 Task Manager allows you to quickly find an application and close it, view the heatmap to diagnose performance issues, understand processes through groupings, and use friendly names and&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Task Manager: example eye tracking data
video:video.video:description: This video tracks a human's eye movements as they look at the new Windows 8 Task Manager. https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/10/13/the-windows-8-task-manager.aspx

video:video.video:title: MUTT and MUTT Pack
video:video.video:description: This video discusses connecting USB Devices to Windows computers. See also: The B8 Blog article on USB3.0: https://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/08/22/building-robust-usb-3-0-support.aspx A new&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Reengineering the Windows Boot experience
video:video.video:description: The Windows 8 Boot experience will reflect the personality of Windows; it will be fast and fluid, seamless, and beautiful every time.

video:video.video:title: Protecting you from Malware
video:video.video:description: Windows 8 protection has been increased through Windows Defender, Internet Explorer 10 URL reputation and the new Windows SmartScreen application reputation functionality.
